CatDescriptText: Mrs. Martha Barnard, clerk typist, 238 Meadows Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 3, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Who do you think is responsible for the failure to pass effective civil rights legislation in Congress?"  Answer reads: "I think that if President Eisenhower had stressed and promoted a civil rights law it would have been enacted."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Martha Barnard wearing eyeglasses and dark plaid collared dress with button down bodice and belt, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
